intro: Phyllanthus karibibensis, commonly known as the Karibib spurge, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. The plant contains various secondary metabolites, which may have potential medicinal uses.
